    debt_long_term: float

    def current_assets(self):

@dataclass
class BalanceSheet:
    """
    Representation of a Balance Sheet. All attributes are listed in
    dollars. Includes functionality for computing common balance sheet metrics
    and ratios.
    """

    # Bank and cash
    cash: float
    accounts_recievable: float
    inventory: float
    # Goodwill and other intangible assets
    goodwill: float
    # Net Property Plant and Equipemt
    property_plant_equipment: float
    accounts_payable: float
    debt_short_term: float
    debt_long_term: float

    def current_assets(self):
        return self.cash + self.accounts_recievable + self.inventory

    def non_current_assets(self):
        return self.goodwill + self.property_plant_equipment

    def total_assets(self):
        return self.current_assets() + self.non_current_assets()

    def current_liabilities(self):

@dataclass
class BalanceSheet:
    """
    Representation of a Balance Sheet. All attributes are listed in
    dollars. Includes functionality for computing common balance sheet metrics
    and ratios.
    """

    # Bank and cash
    cash: float
    accounts_recievable: float
    inventory: float
    # Goodwill and other intangible assets
    goodwill: float
    # Net Property Plant and Equipemt
    property_plant_equipment: float
    accounts_payable: float
    debt_short_term: float
    debt_long_term: float

    def current_assets(self):
        return self.cash + self.accounts_recievable + self.inventory

    def non_current_assets(self):
        return self.goodwill + self.property_plant_equipment

    def total_assets(self):
        return self.current_assets() + self.non_current_assets()

    def current_liabilities(self):
        return self.debt_short_term + self.accounts_payable

    def non_current_liabilities(self):

@dataclass
class IncomeStatement:
    """
    Representation of a Income Statement. All attributes are listed in
    dollars.
    """

    # Sales
    revenue: float
    cost_of_goods_sold: float
    administrative_expenses: float
    depreciation: float
    amortization: float
    # Income from non-core operations
    other_investment_income: float
    # Total tax burden in dollars
    taxes: float
    # Total interest expense in dollars
    interest: float
    shares_outstanding: float
    current_share_price: float

    def gross_profit(self):
        return self.revenue - self.cost_of_goods_sold

    def operating_expenses(self):
        return self.administrative_expenses + self.depreciation + self.amortization

    def operating_income(self):
        return self.gross_profit() - self.operating_expenses()

    def ebit(self):

    def ebit(self):
        return self.operating_income() + self.other_investment_income

    def ebitda(self):

@dataclass
class IncomeStatement:
    """
    Representation of a Income Statement. All attributes are listed in
    dollars.
    """

    # Sales
    revenue: float
    cost_of_goods_sold: float
    administrative_expenses: float
    depreciation: float
    amortization: float
    # Income from non-core operations
    other_investment_income: float
    # Total tax burden in dollars
    taxes: float
    # Total interest expense in dollars
    interest: float
    shares_outstanding: float
    current_share_price: float

    def gross_profit(self):
        return self.revenue - self.cost_of_goods_sold

    def operating_expenses(self):
        return self.administrative_expenses + self.depreciation + self.amortization

    def operating_income(self):
        return self.gross_profit() - self.operating_expenses()

    def ebit(self):
        return self.operating_income() + self.other_investment_income

    def ebitda(self):
        return self.ebit() + self.amortization + self.depreciation

    def pretax_income(self):

@dataclass
class CashFlowStatement:
    """
    Representation of a Statement of Cash Flows. All attributes are listed in
    dollars.
    """

    net_income: float
    depreciation: float
    amortization: float
    # Assume these are the captial expenditures required to maintain production
    capital_expenditures: float
    dividends_paid: float
    interest_paid: float
    acquisitions: float
    accounts_payable: float
    # Negative number
    accounts_recievable: float

    def cash_from_operating_activities(self):
        return self.net_income + self.depreciation + self.amortization + self.accounts_payable + self.accounts_recievable

    def cash_from_investing_activities(self):
        return self.capital_expenditures + self.acquisitions

    def cash_from_financing_activities(self):

question:
@dataclass
class CashFlowStatement:
    """
    Representation of a Statement of Cash Flows. All attributes are listed in
    dollars.
    """

    net_income: float
    depreciation: float
    amortization: float
    # Assume these are the captial expenditures required to maintain production
    capital_expenditures: float
    dividends_paid: float
    interest_paid: float
    acquisitions: float
    accounts_payable: float
    # Negative number
    accounts_recievable: float

    def cash_from_operating_activities(self):
        return self.net_income + self.depreciation + self.amortization + self.accounts_payable + self.accounts_recievable

    def cash_from_investing_activities(self):
        return self.capital_expenditures + self.acquisitions

    def cash_from_financing_activities(self):
        return self.dividends_paid + self.interest_paid

    def retained_earnings(self):
        return self.net_income - self.dividends_paid

    def free_cash_flow(self):

@dataclass
class CashFlowStatement:
    """
    Representation of a Statement of Cash Flows. All attributes are listed in
    dollars.
    """

    net_income: float
    depreciation: float
    amortization: float
    # Assume these are the captial expenditures required to maintain production
    capital_expenditures: float
    dividends_paid: float
    interest_paid: float
    acquisitions: float
    accounts_payable: float
    # Negative number
    accounts_recievable: float

    def cash_from_operating_activities(self):
        return self.net_income + self.depreciation + self.amortization + self.accounts_payable + self.accounts_recievable

    def cash_from_investing_activities(self):
        return self.capital_expenditures + self.acquisitions

    def cash_from_financing_activities(self):
        return self.dividends_paid + self.interest_paid

    def retained_earnings(self):

answer: return self.cash_flow * (((1 + self.interest) ** self.n_payments - 1) / self.interest) * (1 + self.interest)

question:
def simple_interest_rate(principal: float, interest_rate: float, time: float) -> float:
    """
    Compute the total accrued value using a simple interest rate over a specified time frame.

    Parameters
    ----------
    principal: float
        Principal amount in dollars
    interest_rate: float
        Simple interest rate expressed as a rate (i.e. will be between 0 and 1) on a per year basis
    time: float
        Total time in years

    Returns
    -------
    float
        Total amount in account after "time" years (including original principal)
    """

def compound_interest_rate(principal: float, interest_rate: float, time: float, n: int) -> float:
    """
    Compute the total accrued value using a compounding interest rate over a specified time frame.

    Parameters
    ----------
    principal: float
        Principal amount in dollars
    interest_rate: float
        Simple interest rate expressed as a rate (i.e. will be between 0 and 1) on a per year basis
    time: float
        Total time in years
    n: int
        Number of compounds per year

    Returns
    -------
    float
        Total amount in account after "time" years (including original principal)
    """

def wacc(equity: float, debt: float, cost_of_equity: float, cost_of_debt: float, tax_rate: float) -> float:
    """
    Computes the Weighted Average Cost of Capital (WACC).

    Parameters
    ----------
    equity: float
        Amount of equity in dollars
    debt: float
        Amount of debt in dollars
    cost_of_equity: float
        Cost of equity defined as a rate, float between 0 and 1
    cost_of_debt: float
        Cost of debt defined as a rate, float between 0 and 1
    tax_rate: float
        The corporate tax rate

    Returns
    -------
    float
        The Weighted Average Cost of Capital (WACC).

    """
answer:
v = equity + debt
    return (equity / v) * cost_of_equity + (debt / v) * cost_of_debt * (1 - tax_rate)

question:
def enterprise_value(shares_outstanding: int, share_price: float, debt: float, cash: float) -> float:
    """
    Computes the enterprise value of a company.

    Parameters
    ----------
    shares_outstanding: int
        Number of shares that exist
    share_price: float
        Price per share ($)
    debt: float
        Total debt of company, in dollars. Listed as a positive numer
    cash: float
        Cash holdings of company, also in dollars

    Returns
    -------
    float
        Enterprise value of company in dollars
    """

def effective_interest_rate(nominal_rate: float, compounds_per_year: float) -> float:
    """
    Computes the effective annual interest rate for a security with a nominal
    rate (nominal_rate) that compounds multiple times per year (compounds_per_year).

    Parameters
    ----------
    nominal_rate: float
        The nominal interest rate, specified as a float between 0 and 1.
    compounds_per_year: int
        The amount of times the interest is compounded over a year's time.

    Returns
    -------
    float
        Effective annual interest rate
    """

def bond_value(coupon: float, n: float, r: float, par_value: float) -> float:
    """
    Computes the theoretical fair value for a bond.

    Parameters
    ----------
    coupon: float
        Payment recieved for each intermediate coupon before the par value.
    n: float
        Total number of coupons
    r: float
        Discount rate, or risk free return rate.
    par_value: float
        Par value is the final repayment of principal at maturity.

    Returns
    -------
    float
        Value of the bond, dollars
    """
answer: return (coupon * (1 - (1 + r) ** (-1 * n)) / r) + par_value * (1 + r) ** (-1 * n)

question:
def gordon_growth_model(dividend_growth_rate: float, rate_of_return: float, next_year_dividends: float) -> float:
    """
    Computes the "Gordon Growth Value" for a stock.

    Parameters
    ----------
    dividend_growth_rate: float
        Assumed constant growth rate for the dividends in perpetuity.
    rate_of_return: float
        Assumed required rate of return for the stock (cost of equity)
    next_year_dividends: float
        Value of the dividends in the next relevant period (here assumed to be years)

    Returns
    -------
    float
        Value of the stock, according to the model
    """

def zero_coupon_bond_yield(face_value: float, present_value: float, n: int) -> float:
    """
    Compute the yield of a zero coupon bond.

    Parameters
    ----------
    face_value: float
        The face value of the bond.
    present_value: float
        The present value of the bond.
    n: int
        Number of periods

    Returns
    -------
    float
        Bond yield, expressed as a ratio (float between 0 and 1)
    """

def zero_coupon_bond_value(face_value: float, rate: float, time: float) -> float:
    """
    Computes the theoretical value of a bond with zero coupons that pays out a
    single lump sum at maturity.

    Parameters
    ----------
    face_value: float
        The face value of the bond.
    rate: float
        The required rate of return
    years_til_maturity: int
        Total number of years until the bond reaches maturity.

    Returns
    -------
    float
        Theoretical value of the bond
    """

def yield_to_maturity(coupon: float, face_value: float, price: float, years_til_maturity: int) -> float:
    """
    Computes the estimated Yield to Maturity for a bond. Assumes annual coupons
    that pay out "coupon" amount of dollars.

    Parameters
    ----------
    coupon: float
        The annual coupon paid out on the bond.
    face_value: float
        The face value of the bond.
    price: float
        The price of the bond
    years_til_maturity: int
        Total number of years until the bond reaches maturity.

    Returns
    -------
    float
        yield to maturity, as a ratio (i.e. a float between 0 and a 1)
    """

def real_rate_of_return(nominal_rate: float, inflation_rate: float) -> float:
    """
    Computes the "real" rate of return, the rate that takes the corresponding
    rate of inflation into account.

    Parameters
    ----------
    nominal_rate: float
        The nominal rate of return, specified as a float between 0 and 1.
    inflation_rate: float
        The inflation rate, specified as a float between 0 and 1.

    Returns
    -------
    float
        The "real" rate of return
    """

def straight_line_depreciation(intial_value: float, salvage_value: float, useful_life: int, period: int) -> float:
    """
    Computes the straight line depreciation of an asset. Function returns the
    net value after the specified "period" of its total useful life. For
    example, if useful_life is 5 and period is 3, the function will return the
    net value of the asset after the completion of the third time period out of
    five.

    Parameters
    ----------
    intial_value: float
        The starting value of the asset
    salvage_value: float
        The value of the asset at the end of its useful life
    useful_life: int
        The total number of "time periods" that determine the useful life of the asset
    period: int
        Time period 

    Returns
    -------
    float
        Net value at the end of the specified period
    """

def put_option_profit(option_price: float, strike_price: float, current_price: float) -> float:
    """
    Computes the current potential profit or loss on a put option contract (representing a
    single stock) if it was closed out. 
    
    Parameters
    ----------
    option_price: float
        The starting value of the asset
    salvage_value: float
        The value of the asset at the end of its useful life
    useful_life: int
        The total number of "time periods" that determine the useful life of the asset
    period: int
        Time period 

    Returns
    -------
    float
        The current PNL on the option
    """

def call_option_profit(option_price: float, strike_price: float, current_price: float) -> float:
    """
    Computes the current potential profit or loss on a call option contract (representing a
    single stock) if it was closed out. 
    
    Parameters
    ----------
    option_price: float
        The starting value of the asset
    salvage_value: float
        The value of the asset at the end of its useful life
    useful_life: int
        The total number of "time periods" that determine the useful life of the asset
    period: int
        Time period 

    Returns
    -------
    float
        The current PNL on the option 
    """
